intro: Pedicularis sibthorpii var. ochrorrhyncha, commonly known as the yellow sand-parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
